author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Ahmedabad sessions court on Tuesday rejected the bail plea of Hardik Patel, who is facing sedition cases after his agitation demanding reservation benefits for the Patel community in the State.

Earlier too, his bail pleas were rejected by the Gujarat High Court in the sedition cases filed by the Surat and Ahmedabad police.

The 22-year-old was arrested last September, first by the Surat police and subsequently by the Ahmedabad police, who charged him with sedition following a violent agitation he spearheaded in the State.

Meanwhile, BJP MP Vithal Radadia and representatives of the Patel community met Chief Minister Anandiben Patel and State BJP president Vijay Rupani to discuss about the compromise with Hardik and his aides on the quota issue.

“We had a detailed discussion with the Chief Minister and we are hopeful that the issue will be resolved amicably in the next few days,” Mr. Radadia told the media.

For the first time, Hardik’s father Bharat Patel was also accompanied by the BJP MP during his meeting with the Chief Minister and the State party president.

“During the meeting, we apprised the Chief Minister about the demands Mr. Hardik Patel has made to withdraw the quota agitation. The government will positively look into the demands,” Mr. Radadia added.
title: Ahmedabad court rejects Hardik’s bail plea
